verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Successful indeed are the believers,ᵃ

verses.verseString: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي صَلَاتِهِمْ خَاشِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Who are humble in their prayers,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنِ اللَّغْوِ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And who shun what is vain,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِلزَّكَاةِ فَاعِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And who act for the sake of purity,ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And who restrain their sexual passionsa—

verses.verseString: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Except in the presence of their mates or those whom their right hands possess, for such surely are not blameable,ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But whoever seeks to go beyond that, such are transgressors —

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those who are keepers of their trusts and their covenant,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those who keep a guard on their prayers.

verses.verseString: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْوَارِثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: These are the heirs,

verses.verseString: الَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ الْفِرْدَوْسَ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Who inherit Paradise. Therein they will abide.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ سُلَالَةٍ مِنْ طِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We create man of an extract of clay,ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَاهُ نُطْفَةً فِي قَرَارٍ مَكِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: Then We make him a small lifegerm in a firm resting-place,

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا النُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْمُضْغَةَ عِظَامًا فَكَسَوْنَا الْعِظَامَ لَحْمًا ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَاهُ خَلْقًا آخَرَ ۚ فَتَبَارَكَ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ الْخَالِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We make the life-germ a clot, then We make the clot a lump of flesh, then We make (in) the lump of flesh bones, then We clothe the bones with flesh, then We cause it to grow into another creation. So blessed be Allāh, the Best of creators!ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then after that you certainly die.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ تُبْعَثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then on the day of Resurrection you will surely be raised up.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَائِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ الْخَلْقِ غَافِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And indeed We have made above you seven ways — and never are We heedless of creation.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً بِقَدَرٍ فَأَسْكَنَّاهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابٍ بِهِ لَقَادِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We send down water from the cloud according to a measure, then We cause it to settle in the earth, and We are indeed able to carry it away.

verses.verseString: فَأَنْشَأْنَا لَكُمْ بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ مِنْ نَخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَابٍ لَكُمْ فِيهَا فَوَاكِهُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We cause to grow thereby gardens of palm-trees and grapes for you. You have therein many fruits and of them you eat;

verses.verseString: وَشَجَرَةً تَخْرُجُ مِنْ طُورِ سَيْنَاءَ تَنْبُتُ بِالدُّهْنِ وَصِبْغٍ لِلْآكِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And a tree that grows out of Mount SInᵃ i, which produces oil and relish for the eaters.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِي الْأَنْعَامِ لَعِبْرَةً ۖ نُسْقِيكُمْ مِمَّا فِي بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَافِعُ كَثِيرَةٌ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle. We make you to drink of what is in their bellies, and you have in them many advantages and of them you eat,

verses.verseString: وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى الْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And on them and on the ships you are borne.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ فَقَالَ يَا قَوْمِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We sent Noah to his people, so he said: O my people, serve Allāh, you have no God other than Him. Will you not guard against evil?

verses.verseString: فَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ قَوْمِهِ مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَأَنْزَلَ مَلَائِكَةً مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: But the chiefs of those who disbelieved from among his people said: He is nothing but a mortal like yourselves, who desires to have superiority over you. And if Allāh had pleased, He could have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our fathers of yore.

verses.verseString: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ فَتَرَبَّصُوا بِهِ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: He is only a madman, so bear with him for a time.

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ انْصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
verses.verseStringB: He said: My Lord, help me against their calling me a liar.

verses.verseString: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْهِ أَنِ اصْنَعِ الْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ التَّنُّورُ ۙ فَاسْلُكْ فِيهَا مِنْ كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَنْ سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ الْقَوْلُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُخَاطِبْنِي فِي الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ مُغْرَقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So We revealed to him: Make the ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation; then when Our command comes, and water gushes forth from the valley, take into it of every kind a pair, two,ᵃ and thy people, except those among them against whom the word has gone forth, and speak not to Me in respect of those who are unjust; surely they will be drowned.

verses.verseString: فَإِذَا اسْتَوَيْتَ أَنْتَ وَمَنْ مَعَكَ عَلَى الْفُلْكِ فَقُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي نَجَّانَا مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then when thou art firmly seated, thou and those with thee, in the ark, say: Praise be to Allāh, Who delivered us from the unjust people!

verses.verseString: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَنْزِلْنِي مُنْزَلًا مُبَارَكًا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الْمُنْزِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And say: My Lord, cause me to land a blessed landing and Thou art the Best of those who bring to land.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ وَإِنْ كُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely there are signs in this, and surely We are ever trying (men).

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا آخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We raised after them another generation.

verses.verseString: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ رَسُولًا مِنْهُمْ أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مَا لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ غَيْرُهُ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So We sent among them a messenger from among them, saying: Serve Allāh — you have no God other than Him. Will you not guard against evil?

verses.verseString: وَقَالَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْ قَوْمِهِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِلِقَاءِ الْآخِرَةِ وَأَتْرَفْنَاهُمْ فِي الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا مَا هَٰذَا إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُكُمْ يَأْكُلُ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ مِنْهُ وَيَشْرَبُ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And the chiefs of his people who disbelieved and called the meeting of the Hereafter a lie, and whom We had given plenty to enjoy in this world’s life, said: This is only a mortal like you, eating of that whereof you eat and drinking of what you drink.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُمْ بَشَرًا مِثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَخَاسِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And if you obey a mortal like yourselves, then surely you are losers.

verses.verseString: أَيَعِدُكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ إِذَا مِتُّمْ وَكُنْتُمْ تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَنَّكُمْ مُخْرَجُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Does he promise you that, when you are dead and become dust and bones, you will then be brought forth?

verses.verseString: هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Far, very far, is that which you are promised:

verses.verseString: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ
verses.verseStringB: There is naught but our life in this world: we die and we live and we shall not be raised again:

verses.verseString: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا وَمَا نَحْنُ لَهُ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He is naught but a man who has forged a lie against Allāh, and we are not going to believe in him.

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ انْصُرْنِي بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
verses.verseStringB: He said: My Lord, help me against their calling me a liar.

verses.verseString: قَالَ عَمَّا قَلِيلٍ لَيُصْبِحُنَّ نَادِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said: In a little while they will certainly be repenting.

verses.verseString: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّيْحَةُ بِالْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ غُثَاءً ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So the punishment overtook them in justice, and We made them as rubbish; so away with the unjust people!ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَنْشَأْنَا مِنْ بَعْدِهِمْ قُرُونًا آخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We raised after them other generations.

verses.verseString: مَا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: No people can hasten on their doom, nor can they postpone (it).

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا رُسُلَنَا تَتْرَىٰ ۖ كُلَّ مَا جَاءَ أُمَّةً رَسُولُهَا كَذَّبُوهُ ۚ فَأَتْبَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ بَعْضًا وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَحَادِيثَ ۚ فَبُعْدًا لِقَوْمٍ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We sent Our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came to a people, they called him a liar, so We made them follow one another and We made them stories. So away with a people who believe not!ᵃ

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَأَخَاهُ هَارُونَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our messages and a clear authority

verses.verseString: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ فَاسْتَكْبَرُوا وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا عَالِينَ
verses.verseStringB: To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they behaved haughtily and they were an insolent people.

verses.verseString: فَقَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لِبَشَرَيْنِ مِثْلِنَا وَقَوْمُهُمَا لَنَا عَابِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So they said: Shall we believe in two mortals like ourselves while their people serve us?

verses.verseString: فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَكَانُوا مِنَ الْمُهْلَكِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So they rejected them and became of those who were destroyed.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We gave Moses the Book that they might go aright.

verses.verseString: وَجَعَلْنَا ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ وَأُمَّهُ آيَةً وَآوَيْنَاهُمَا إِلَىٰ رَبْوَةٍ ذَاتِ قَرَارٍ وَمَعِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground having meadows and springs.ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَا أَيُّهَا الرُّسُلُ كُلُوا مِنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَاعْمَلُوا صَالِحًا ۖ إِنِّي بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: O ye messengers, eat of the good things and do good. Surely I am Knower of what you do.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ هَٰذِهِ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةً وَاحِدَةً وَأَنَا رَبُّكُمْ فَاتَّقُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And surely this your community is one community, and I am your Lord, so keep your duty to Me.

verses.verseString: فَتَقَطَّعُوا أَمْرَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًا ۖ كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But they became divided into sects, each party rejoicing in that which was with them.

verses.verseString: فَذَرْهُمْ فِي غَمْرَتِهِمْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: So leave them in their ignorance till a time.

verses.verseString: أَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّمَا نُمِدُّهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Think they that by the wealth and children wherewith We aid them,

verses.verseString: نُسَارِعُ لَهُمْ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ ۚ بَلْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: We are hastening to them of good things? Nay, they perceive not.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ رَبِّهِمْ مُشْفِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely they who live in awe for fear of their Lord,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those who believe in the messages of their Lord,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِرَبِّهِمْ لَا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those who associate naught with their Lord,

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْتُونَ مَا آتَوْا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ رَاجِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those who give what they give while their hearts are full of fear that to their Lord they must return —

verses.verseString: أُولَٰئِكَ يُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَهُمْ لَهَا سَابِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: These hasten to good things and they are foremost in attaining them.

verses.verseString: وَلَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا ۖ وَلَدَيْنَا كِتَابٌ يَنْطِقُ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We lay not on any soul a burden except to the extent of its ability, and with Us is a book which speaks the truth, and they are not wronged.

verses.verseString: بَلْ قُلُوبُهُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا وَلَهُمْ أَعْمَالٌ مِنْ دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ هُمْ لَهَا عَامِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, their hearts are in ignorance about it, and they have besides this other deeds which they do.

verses.verseString: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِمْ بِالْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْأَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Until, when We seize those who lead easy lives among them with chastisement, lo! they cry for succour.

verses.verseString: لَا تَجْأَرُوا الْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّكُمْ مِنَّا لَا تُنْصَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Cry not for succour this day. Surely you will not be helped by Us.

verses.verseString: قَدْ كَانَتْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنْتُمْ عَلَىٰ أَعْقَابِكُمْ تَنْكِصُونَ
verses.verseStringB: My messages were indeed recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels

verses.verseString: مُسْتَكْبِرِينَ بِهِ سَامِرًا تَهْجُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Haughtily, passing nights in talking nonsense about it.

verses.verseString: أَفَلَمْ يَدَّبَّرُوا الْقَوْلَ أَمْ جَاءَهُمْ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِ آبَاءَهُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Do they not then ponder the Word? Or has there come to them that which did not come to their fathers of old?

verses.verseString: أَمْ لَمْ يَعْرِفُوا رَسُولَهُمْ فَهُمْ لَهُ مُنْكِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or do they not recognize their Messenger, that they deny him?

verses.verseString: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِ جِنَّةٌ ۚ بَلْ جَاءَهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَارِهُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or say they: There is madness in him? Nay, he has brought them the Truth, and most of them hate the Truth.

verses.verseString: وَلَوِ اتَّبَعَ الْحَقُّ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ لَفَسَدَتِ السَّمَاوَاتُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَنْ فِيهِنَّ ۚ بَلْ أَتَيْنَاهُمْ بِذِكْرِهِمْ فَهُمْ عَنْ ذِكْرِهِمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And if the Truth follow their desires, the heavens and the earth and all those who are therein would perish. Nay, We have brought them their reminder, but they turn away from their reminder.

verses.verseString: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ خَرْجًا فَخَرَاجُ رَبِّكَ خَيْرٌ ۖ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ الرَّازِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Or dost thou ask them a recompense? But the recompense of thy Lord is best, and He is the Best of providers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّكَ لَتَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: And surely thou callest them to a right way.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ عَنِ الصِّرَاطِ لَنَاكِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And surely those who believe not in the Hereafter are deviating from the way.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْ رَحِمْنَاهُمْ وَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِمْ مِنْ ضُرٍّ لَلَجُّوا فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And if We show mercy to them and remove the distress they have, they would persist in their inordInᵃ cy, blindly wandering on.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَاهُمْ بِالْعَذَابِ فَمَا اسْتَكَانُوا لِرَبِّهِمْ وَمَا يَتَضَرَّعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And already We seized them with chastisement, but they were not submissive to their Lord, nor did they humble themselves.ᵃ

verses.verseString: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ بَابًا ذَا عَذَابٍ شَدِيدٍ إِذَا هُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Until, when We open for them a door of severe chastisement, lo! they are in despair at it.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And He it is Who made for you the ears and the eyes and the hearts. Little it is that you give thanks!

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And He it is Who multiplied you in the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ وَلَهُ اخْتِلَافُ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And He it is Who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Do you not then understand?

verses.verseString: بَلْ قَالُوا مِثْلَ مَا قَالَ الْأَوَّلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, they say the like of what the ancients said.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَامًا أَإِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They say: When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then be raised up?

verses.verseString: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا نَحْنُ وَآبَاؤُنَا هَٰذَا مِنْ قَبْلُ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: We are indeed promised this, and (so were) our fathers before. This is naught but stories of those of old!

verses.verseString: قُلْ لِمَنِ الْأَرْضُ وَمَنْ فِيهَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Whose is the earth, and whoever is therein, if you know?

verses.verseString: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say: Allāh’s. Say: Will you not then mind?

verses.verseString: قُلْ مَنْ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَرَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne of power?

verses.verseString: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say: (This is) Allāh’s. Say: Will you not then guard against evil?

verses.verseString: قُلْ مَنْ بِيَدِهِ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَهُوَ يُجِيرُ وَلَا يُجَارُ عَلَيْهِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Who is it in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things and He protects, and none is protected against Him, if you know?

verses.verseString: سَيَقُولُونَ لِلَّهِ ۚ قُلْ فَأَنَّىٰ تُسْحَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say: (This is) Allāh’s. Say: Whence are you then deceived?

verses.verseString: بَلْ أَتَيْنَاهُمْ بِالْحَقِّ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَكَاذِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, We have brought them the Truth and surely they are liars.

verses.verseString: مَا اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِنْ وَلَدٍ وَمَا كَانَ مَعَهُ مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ ۚ إِذًا لَذَهَبَ كُلُّ إِلَٰهٍ بِمَا خَلَقَ وَلَعَلَا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Allāh has not taken to Himself a son, nor is there with Him any (other) god — in that case would each god have taken away what he created, and some of them would have overpowered others. Glory be to Allāh above what they describe —

verses.verseString: عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The Knower of the unseen and the seen; so may He be exalted above what they associate (with Him)!

verses.verseString: قُلْ رَبِّ إِمَّا تُرِيَنِّي مَا يُوعَدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: My Lord, if Thou show me that which they are promised —

verses.verseString: رَبِّ فَلَا تَجْعَلْنِي فِي الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: My Lord, then place me not with the unjust people.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُرِيَكَ مَا نَعِدُهُمْ لَقَادِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And surely We are well Able to show thee what We promise them.ᵃ

verses.verseString: ادْفَعْ بِالَّتِي هِيَ أَحْسَنُ السَّيِّئَةَ ۚ نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَصِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Repel evil with that which is best.ᵃ We know best what they describe.

verses.verseString: وَقُلْ رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ هَمَزَاتِ الشَّيَاطِينِ
verses.verseStringB: And say: My Lord, I seek refuge in Thee from the evil suggestions of the devils,ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ رَبِّ أَنْ يَحْضُرُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And I seek refuge in Thee, my Lord, lest they come to me.

verses.verseString: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَ أَحَدَهُمُ الْمَوْتُ قَالَ رَبِّ ارْجِعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: Until when death overtakes one of them,ᵃ he says: My Lord, send me back,ᵇ

verses.verseString: لَعَلِّي أَعْمَلُ صَالِحًا فِيمَا تَرَكْتُ ۚ كَلَّا ۚ إِنَّهَا كَلِمَةٌ هُوَ قَائِلُهَا ۖ وَمِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ بَرْزَخٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: That I may do good in that which I have left. By no means! It is but a word that he speaks. And before them is a barrier, until the day they are raised.ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ فَلَا أَنْسَابَ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَلَا يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So when the trumpet is blown, there will be no ties of relationship among them that day, nor will they ask of one another.

verses.verseString: فَمَنْ ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then those whose good deeds are heavy, those are the successful.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And those whose good deeds are light, those are they who have lost their souls, abiding in hell.

verses.verseString: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ النَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَالِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The Fire will scorch their faces, and they therein will be in severe affliction.

verses.verseString: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Were not My messages recited to you, but you used to reject them?

verses.verseString: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًا ضَالِّينَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say: Our Lord, our adversity overcame us, and we were an erring people.

verses.verseString: رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَالِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Our Lord, take us out of it; then if we return (to evil), we shall be unjust.

verses.verseString: قَالَ اخْسَئُوا فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ
verses.verseStringB: He will say: Begone therein, and speak not to Me.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِنْ عِبَادِي يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely there was a party of My servants who said: Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us and have mercy on us, and Thou art the Best of those who show mercy.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰ أَنْسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِي وَكُنْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But you ridiculed them, until they made you forget remembrance of Me, and you used to laugh at them.ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنِّي جَزَيْتُهُمُ الْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely I have rewarded them this day because they were patient, that they are the achievers.

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He will say: How many years did you tarry in the earth?

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَاسْأَلِ الْعَادِّينَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say: We tarried a day or part of a day, but ask those who keep account.

verses.verseString: قَالَ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He will say: You tarried but a little — if you only knew!

verses.verseString: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Do you then think that We have created you in vain, and that you will not be returned to Us?ᵃ

verses.verseString: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: So exalted be Allāh, the True King! No God is there but He, the Lord of the Throne of Grace.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And whoever invokes, besides Allāh, another god — he has no proof of this — his reckoning is only with his Lord. Surely the disbelievers will not be successful.

verses.verseString: وَقُلْ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And say: My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and Thou art the Best of those who show merc

footnotes.note:
1a. The last two chapters opened with a warning of the approach of judgment. This,      as a fitting sequel, opens with a declaration of the triumph of the believers, for it was possible that the wicked should have tasted punishment without resultant good to the faithful.      To dispel all such doubts it is stated that the believers shall be successful even in this life.

      4a. Få‘il∂n (from fi‘l, doing) means doers of deeds, and li-l-zakåt means for the sake      of purity or to attain purity. The word zakåt means originally purity, as in 19:13, while      zakåt in the sense of poor-rate is spoken of as being paid, yu‘t∂n al-zakåt — they pay      zakåt, being always the form adopted. Hence the significance adopted here — they do      what they do for the sake of, or to attain to, purity.

      5a. Fur∂j, plural of farj, indicates the part of a person which it is indecent to expose      (LL), particularly the pudenda. In this sense √if˚ al-farj means generally the observing of      continence, or the restraining of sexual passions.      6a. The words au må malakat aimånu-hum, of which a literal rendering is given in the      translation, usually indicate slaves. It should be noted that this chapter is a Makkan revelation, and the conditions under which slave-girls could be taken as wives were given later at      Madßnah; see 4:25a. If the reference here is to sexual relations, the permission regarding      those whom their right hands possess must be read subject to the conditions of 4:25. It      may be added that slave-girls, when taken as wives, did not acquire the full status of a free      wife, and hence they are spoken of distinctly. It may, however, be added that √if˚ al-farj in      a wider sense means the covering of parts of the body which it is indecent to expose, and in      this connection it must be borne in mind that according to Islamic rules of decency, the      exposure of such parts of the body, as are generally exposed in ballrooms and theatres, is      disallowed, but a certain degree of freedom is allowed to women in the presence of their      husbands and female servants and to men in the presence of their wives and male servants. 

      12a. The creation of man is here traced back to earth, for the life-germ in sperma is      an extract of food, which is drawn from earth in whatever form it may be. It should be      noted that while the first ten verses speak of the spiritual growth of man, his physical      growth is here spoken of, and thus a comparison may be established between the physical and the spiritual growth. Though described in the past tense, it is a general law of the      creation of man that is spoken of here. The addition of the words, then We cause it to      grow into another creation (v. 14), is to show that man’s creation does not end with the      completion of the different stages of physical growth, as in the case of other animals, but      he is endowed with certain other faculties — the reference being to the moral and spiritual side of man’s growth.

      14a. The several stages in the growth of the human child, as given here, and      unknown then, are quite in accordance with scientific investigation. It should be borne in      mind that the word fa, meaning then, as used in then We clothe the bones ... does not      always imply order. This is clear from the context, which states that there is first a lump      of flesh, and the nucleus of the bones is generated in this flesh.

      17a. Instead of the seven heavens, here we have the seven ways, which are no doubt        the orbits of the seven members of the solar system, excluding the earth, as shown by      the words above you.

      20a. In the tree that grows out of Mount Sinai, and which produces oil, there seems      to be reference to the blessed olive tree of 24:35, as representing the Muslim nation; see      24:35a.

      27a. See 11:40a, 40b, 42a.

      33a. The prophets are rejected because they are subject to the same laws of nature in      their human requirements as other men. And no one can be a model for men, who is not      himself a human being, and who is not subject to the same laws of nature as other men,      for only a man can show men how they can avoid falling a prey to the frailties of human      nature. Hence, a Divine incarnation, or God in a human body, cannot serve as a model to      men. We want a mortal to show us how to avoid the pitfalls with which we, as mortals,      are surrounded; if God Himself comes into the world, He cannot serve this purpose.

      41a. It is the occurrence of the word ©ai√ah in this verse which has led many to      think that vv. 33 – 41 of this section refer to H∂d or ˝åli√. But it should be borne in mind      that ©ai√ah means punishment (LL), and is equally applicable to punishment by earthquake or by any other means. There has been much discussion as to the land spoken of in this verse. Rabwah      is lofty ground, and qarår means cultivated land, and a place where water rests in a      meadow (LL). Jerusalem, Egypt, Palestine or Damascus, which are the names suggested,      do not answer the description, which applies exactly to the valley of Kashmir. Part of      the lost ten tribes of Israel is also traced to Kashmir, where a large number of towns and      villages bear the names of the towns and villages of Palestine. The presence of a tomb      known as the tomb of Nabß (i.e., the prophet), or ‘Íså (i.e., Jesus), or Y∂z Åsaf, in the      Khån Yår street in the capital of Kashmir, lends additional support to this theory. The      fact that the chapter deals with the final triumph of prophets and their followers and their      deliverance from the hands of their enemies also gives us a clue to the mystery attending      the circumstances of the disappearance of Jesus Christ after the event of the Cross; for,      as shown in 4:157a, Jesus did not die on the cross. According to a saying of the Holy      Prophet, Jesus lived 120 years (IK, vol. ii, p. 246). This verse tells us that, being delivered from the hands of his enemies, he was given shelter at some other place, and the      description of that place as indicated in this verse, along with the fact that Kashmir has a      tomb, which every available evidence shows to be the tomb of Jesus himself, leads us to      the conclusion that Kashmir is the land referred to in this verse.n
      As regards the tomb, the following evidence shows that the sacred body of no less a      personage than Jesus Christ rests there: (a) oral testimony, based on tradition, of the      people of Kashmir tells us that the tomb belongs to one who bore the name of Y∂z Åsaf,      who was known as a nabß (i.e., a prophet), and who came to Kashmir from the West      about 2,000 years ago; (b) the Tårßkh A‘˚amß, an historical work written some two hundred years ago, says, referring to this tomb, on p. 82: “The tomb is generally known as      that of a prophet. He was a prince, who came to Kashmir from a foreign land.... His      name was Y∂z Åsaf ”; (c) the Ikmål al-Dßn, an Arabic work, which is a thousand years      old, also mentions Y∂z Åsaf as having travelled in some lands; (d) Joseph Jacobs states,      on the authority of a very old version of the story of Y∂z Åsaf, that he (Joasaph) at last      reached Kashmir, and there died (Barlaam and Josaphat, p. cv).      This evidence shows that the tomb in Khån Yår (Srinagar) is the tomb of Y∂z Åsaf.      But who is this Y∂z Åsaf ? That he is called a nabß (prophet) both in oral tradition and in      history settles the time in which he lived, for no prophet is recognized by the Muslims to      have appeared after their Holy Prophet. Again, there is a striking resemblance between      the names Y∂z and Yas∂‘, the latter being the Hebrew form of Jesus. There is also a      remarkable similarity in the teachings of Y∂z Åsaf and Jesus; for instance, the parable of      the seed-sower occurring in Matt. 13:3, Mark 4:3 and Luke 8:5 occurs also in “Barlaam      and Josaphat” (p. cxi). Another very striking circumstance is that Y∂z Åsaf gave the      name Bushrå (Arabic for Gospel) to his teachings, as the following passage from the      Ikmål al-Dßn shows: “Then he began to compare the tree to the Bushrå, which he      preached to the people”. All these circumstances lead us to the conclusion that Jesus      Christ went to Kashmir after the event of the crucifixion, and that he preached, lived,      died and was buried there.

      95a. The promise given to the Holy Prophet in these verses is that the power of his      persecutors will be broken in his lifetime.

      96a. The doing of good in return for evil is the common teaching of all prophets.      But nowhere is the principle put in such a beautiful and practical form as in the Qur’ån.      To return good for evil is only possible under certain circumstances, and the Gospel      doctrine — that ye resist not evil — has not been found practicable. The Qur’ån, however, says, repel evil with that which is best. In repelling evil the rule to be observed is that      it must be repelled by what is best. If you can repel an evil by doing good for it, it is the      course recommended; but if punishment is necessary, that would be the better course. It      is the only workable principle of life.

      97a. The evil suggestions of the devils were really suggestions of the wicked, who      were opposed to the progress of Islåm, and the Prophet is here told to look upon Allåh as      his only support. To seek refuge in the Lord is the height of goodness. Nowhere has a      man a better refuge than in the Source of all strength, and no mortal can aspire to a higher honour than having his refuge in the Lord. The command to the Prophet to say this is      really an image of the aspiration of his soul, the inmost desire which furnished the      guiding rule of his life. His soul rested in that highest degree of security from all evil      suggestions, which is termed refuge in the Lord.

      100a. That the dead do not return to life is a principle which is reaffirmed here; see also      21:95a.
